title: Is there a connection between the ancient traditions of America and Europe and the lost land of Atlantis?
first_phrase: In this final section, the author delves into the complementary traditions of the Celts and ancient Mexicans, both of whom talk about their origins from a land in the North Atlantic. The author posits that these are two forms of a unified testimony of a lost or uninhabitable land that was the center of an irradiation of races. The concept of Atlantis is discussed, and the author clarifies the distinction between the hyperborean and Atlantean centers. Finally, the author notes how modern research validates these prehistoric perspectives.

last_phrase: Therefore, it is essential to distinguish between the Hyperborean and Atlantean centers, as well as between the Hyperborean and Atlantean traditions. After making this distinction, we can find elements in modern research that fit into the prehistoric perspectives mentioned earlier. Traces of a superior civilization and a noble biological race, the Cro-magnon, have been discovered along the Atlantic coast of Europe (and even Iberian-African). Therefore, it is plausible to think that they may be of the same origin as the Tuatha dé Danann of Irish mythology, the "divine race" that came to Europe from the mysterious North Atlantic land.
